body_html:
I've actually seen this issue myself on some internal machines. It looks like it is trying to use the built NCCL (located under torch/lib/tmp_install/lib/) but can't find it. We'll investigate.

As a workaround you can use a standard CMake build:

mkdir build; cd build; cmake ..; make -j 20; make install

but eventually this won't work because we'll be doing more Caffe2 and PyTorch configuration in setup.py.

cc @pjh5, @soumith, and @Yangqing

body:
I've actually seen this issue myself on some internal machines. It looks like it is trying to use the built NCCL (located under  `torch/lib/tmp_install/lib/`) but can't find it. We'll investigate.

As a workaround you can use a standard CMake build:

```
mkdir build; cd build; cmake ..; make -j 20; make install
```

but eventually this won't work because we'll be doing more Caffe2 and PyTorch configuration in setup.py.

cc @pjh5, @soumith, and @Yangqing
